item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "One of the pitfalls of childhood is that one doesn't have to understand something to feel it. By the time the mind is able to comprehend what has happened, the wounds of the heart are already too deep." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "We are willing to believe anything other than the truth." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Saul Williams
item.description: "only through new words might new worlds be called into order" -- Saul Williams

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The one you love and the one who loves you are never, ever the same person." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Dean Spade
item.description: "The point for me is to create relationships based on deeper and more real notions of trust. So that love becomes defined not by sexual exclusivity, but by actual respect, concern, commitment to act with kind intentions, accountability for our actions, and a desire for mutual growth." -- Dean Spade

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Dean Spade
item.description: "Let’s be gentle with ourselves and each other and fierce as we fight oppression." -- Dean Spade

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by James Gilligan
item.description: "The most dangerous men on earth are those who are afraid they are wimps" -- James Gilligan

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Fatima Mernissi
item.description: "Pessimism is the luxury of the powerful." -- Fatima Mernissi

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "The best thing for being sad," replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, "is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the world about you devastated by evil lunatics, or know your honour trampled in the sewers of baser minds. There is only one thing for it then — to learn. Learn why the world wags and what wags it. That is the only thing which the mind can never exhaust, never alienate, never be tortured by, never fear or distrust, and never dream of regretting. Learning is the only thing for you. Look what a lot of things there are to learn." -- T.H. White

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by C.R. Strahan
item.description: "Forgiveness has nothing to do with absolving a criminal of his crime. It has everything to do with relieving oneself of the burden of being a victim--letting go of the pain and transforming oneself from victim to survivor." -- C.R. Strahan

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Toba Beta
item.description: "In wars amongst ideas, doubters are the victims." -- Toba Beta

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Rebecca West
item.description: "I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat." -- Rebecca West

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself" -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Margaret Sanger
item.description: "No woman can call herself free who does not control her own body." -- Margaret Sanger

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Sojourner Truth
item.description: "If women want rights more than they got, why don't they just take them, and not be talking about it." -- Sojourner Truth

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "There are years that ask questions and years that answer." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: ~V.W.~ add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "She stood there until something fell off the shelf inside her." -- Zora Neale Hurston
